Package monkey.mnk

Class ThreatsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • monkey.mnk.ThreatsManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class ThreatsManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A ThreatsManager for a certain L counts the L-long Threats with no hole and the L-1-long Threats with a hole in them. A single istance of this class takes Î˜(ALIGNMENTS) memory.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreatsManager

        public ThreatsManager​(int l,
                      Board b)
        Constructs a new ThreatsManager given the L parameter and a Board. The actual MNKCellStates of the Board do not matter. Takes Î˜(ALIGNMENTS) time.
        Parameters:
        l - The L parameter. Must be greater than 1.
        b - The Board to consider.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - l is not greater than 1.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - b is null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • updateAlignments

        public void updateAlignments​(Position pos,
                             Player pl)
        (Un)records a mark for the whole Board. Takes Î˜(L) time.
        Parameters:
        pos - Position of the mark to (un)record.
        pl - The Player responsible for the change.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Either position or cellStates are meant for another M-N-K tuple.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Either pos, pl, or cellStates are null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard​(Board b)
        Sets a new Board whose dimensions must be the same for the previous one. The actual MNKCellStates of the Board do not matter.
        Parameters:
        b - The new Board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The dimensions of the grid changed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • count

        public int count​(Threat t,
                 Player p)
        Returns the number of Threats of the specified nature and threatener.
        Parameters:
        t - Queried Threat type.
        p - The Player to be used as threatener.
        Returns:
        Current value of the counter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Either t or p are null.
        Since:
        1.0
